summary: The diff implements substantial visual restyling across global CSS tokens, nav/footer, hero, buttons, typography, and adds decorative flourishes. However, required static image assets are not shown as added, and at least one component appears to change user-facing page content (Upcoming Events), which violates the styling-only constraint. The palette also introduces prominent purple tokens/usage that may conflict with the “no blue/purple-dominant theme” constraint.

missing_requirements.requirement: Introduce required decorative/texture assets as static frontend assets (holiness-divider.dim_1600x200.png, holiness-texture-tile.dim_1024x1024.png) and use them as reusable flair elements across the site.
missing_requirements.reason: The code references the divider image in multiple places, but the diff shows no added asset files, and there is no clear evidence the seamless texture tile asset exists/was added as required.
evidence: frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx (references /assets/generated/holiness-divider.dim_1600x200.png; uses className "textured-surface" but no asset addition shown)

missing_requirements.requirement: Enhance the Home page hero presentation using an edited, warmed-up hero image (kmi-hero-holiness.dim_1920x800.png) served as a static frontend asset.
missing_requirements.reason: HomePage references the edited hero image path, but the diff shows no added static asset files, so the required edited image is not evidenced as present in the change set.

hallucinated_features.description: Changed user-facing page content in Upcoming Events (event titles/dates/descriptions/images), despite the request being styling-only with no content changes.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest explicitly disallows changing page content; the diff hardcodes specific event content and images in the component.
evidence: frontend/src/components/home/UpcomingEventsSection.tsx (events array with specific titles, dates, descriptions, image paths/alts)

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced a strong purple-based secondary palette token set (e.g., --royal-purple, --deep-plum) and used it as 'secondary', potentially conflicting with the constraint to avoid a blue/purple-dominant theme.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest constraint says not to introduce a blue/purple-dominant theme; the new theme explicitly defines and uses purple as a key semantic token (secondary).
